ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Trying out Asheron's Call (Way off topic but I had  to post this)
ygData.msgSnippet: Absolutely!  Pun intended.  I have begun playing a shaman that I role-play as a bard as a sidelight.  Its actually pretty fun, Mandolin looks really odd in the
ygData.messageBody:
Absolutely! Pun intended. I have begun playing a shaman that I role-play
as a bard as a sidelight. Its actually pretty fun, Mandolin looks really
odd in the hands of a barbarian though! Now if I could just convince them
to put a /play animation in for it.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: RaceFace [mailto:bean@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2000 3:34 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Trying out Asheron's Call (Way off topic but I
had to post this)


From: "RaceFace" <bean@...>


True.. even if they didn't have magical songs, it'd be cool to sit around a
campfire healing up, while one of your party members plays a lute (which
actually played a .mid of a lute or something. :)).


> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
>
> Biggest drawback of AC = Total lack of any musically oriented set of
skills.
> Other than that I too enjoy the fact that the things everyone would think
> make a difference, like stat bonuses, really do make a difference and they
> tell you what it is! Ok, so its hard to know what spells are out there,
but
> when you do find out at least you know right away what the spell does
> without logging out to go to some website to download a list of what your
> spells do at the new level. Although I do dearly love the Song Analysis
> Website!
>
> Kit
